words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: We won’t be promoting Larry.
She teaches yoga to promote health and well-being.
The organization is committed to promoting equality and fairness for every person.
Anna was promoted to manager last year, and she's been in the fast lane ever since.
Earth Day is observed on April 22nd to promote environmental awareness.
words.defineEn: to move to a higher position or rank
words.defineVi: để di chuyển đến một vị trí cao hơn hoặc xếp hạng

examples: My father pays his bills at the beginning of the month.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
Not paying attention.
They both pay their employees badly.
No one paid them any attention.
words.defineEn: the money that is paid to someone for doing their job
words.defineVi: số tiền được trả cho ai đó để làm công việc của họ

examples: The sun always rises in the east.
The basic pay of the average worker has risen by 3 per cent.
The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
Tax rises have made some inroads into the country's national debt.
On the credit side, inflation has not risen this year.
words.defineEn: an increase in something's number, amount, size, power, or value
words.defineVi: sự gia tăng về số lượng, số lượng, kích thước, sức mạnh hoặc giá trị của một cái gì đó

examples: They practice their soccer skills every day after school.
We learn new skills from our parents, who teach us with patience.
A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.
I took my hat off to his cooking skill.
To learn a language/skill/trade.
words.defineEn: an ability to do something well, especially after training
words.defineVi: một khả năng để làm một cái gì đó tốt, đặc biệt là sau khi đào tạo

examples: They hired a detective firm to dig up dirt on their rival.
They hired a violin teacher to guide them in their learning.
After years of mismanagement, they hired a new CEO to turn things around.
A babysitter was hired to take care of the baby while the parents were out.
Local people took matters into their own hands and hired their own security guards.
words.defineEn: to pay someone to do a job
words.defineVi: trả tiền cho ai đó để làm một công việc

examples: The farmer employs modern agricultural techniques to maximize the yield of his soybean crop.
This company tends to employ young women have an eye to the main chance.
The dessert mousse employed a gelatin-based thickening agent to create a light and airy texture.
They’re breaking the law by employing such young children.
The election promise of employing the large number of unemployed graduates has become a milestone round the neck of the coalition government.
words.defineEn: to give work to someone and pay them
words.defineVi: giao việc cho ai đó và trả tiền cho họ

examples: The referee gave him the benefit of the doubt.
The changes benefit management but leave the workers out in the cold.
Only a minority of people exist on unemployment benefits alone.
My friend studied the nutritional benefits of different legumes for her research project.
I prefer brown rice over white rice for its nutritional benefits.
words.defineEn: an advantage or a helpful effect that is the result of a situation
words.defineVi: một lợi thế hoặc một hiệu ứng hữu ích đó là kết quả của một tình huống

examples: So, if there's a simple way to make your business more profitable, you should perk your ears.
The company wants to hire her at any cost, so she can basically take her pick of perks during the negotiation process.
Both systems or both platforms have different perks.
Both have different perks.
Both have different perks.
words.defineEn: an extra benefit, advantage, or privilege that one receives in addition to one's salary due to one's job
words.defineVi: một lợi ích bổ sung, lợi thế, hoặc đặc quyền mà một người nhận được ngoài tiền lương của một người do công việc của một người
